snippet: The senators brought similar backgrounds and Tea Party fervor to Washington, but any alliance between them frayed as they moved closer to seeking the White House.
abstract: Sen Ted Cruz is privately telling colleagues that he thinks race for Republican Party's presidential nomination will ultimately be between him and his fellow Cuban-American Sen Marco Rubio, belief that other leading Republicans share, particularly after most recent debate; men have staked out opposite sides in contest, with Cruz emphasizing ideological purity while Rubio stresses his ability to get things accomplished, but they have so far avoided direct confrontation.
lead_paragraph: The senators brought similar backgrounds and Tea Party fervor to Washington, but any alliance between them frayed as they moved closer to seeking the White House.

headline.main: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio Grow Apart as Their Ambitions Expand
headline.print_headline: Now Aiming Higher, Cruz and Rubio Drift Apart
